name: John_Jacob_Astor
text:
John Jacob Astor
John Jacob Astor was a timber and fur mogul who sent envoys to the Pacific Northwest to retrieve beavers following the expedition of Lewis and Clark.
The Millhouse family of Mine Hollow claimed that Astor was their great uncle "a couple of times" removed.
Behind the scenes
John Jacob Astor (July 17, 1763 – March 29, 1848) was a German-American businessman noted to be the first multi-millionaire of the United States, having earned his fortune from fur trade and real estate.
